question: Who became the first person in human history to deadlift five times his own body weight (-lifting 661 pounds (300 kg) at a bodyweight of 132 pounds (60 kg))?
explanation: Lamar Gant is an American world record-holding powerlifter. He competed with idiopathic scoliosis. He was inducted into the International Powerlifting Federation Hall of Fame in 1980. In 1985, he became the first person in human history to deadlift five times his own body weight - lifting 661 pounds (300 kg) at a bodyweight of 132 pounds (60 kg).
